properties.areaDesc: Western/Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft; Teller County/Rampart Range above 7500fT/Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft; Wet Mountains above 10000 Ft; Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft; Northwestern Fremont County  Above 8500Ft; Northern El Paso County/Monument Ridge/Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft; Canon City Vicinity/Eastern Fremont County; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 3 at 4:18AM MST until February 4 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Pueblo CO
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches
across the higher terrain, with 2 to 6 inches across the lower
elevations. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph.

* WHERE...Fremont County, Teller County, Northern El Paso County,
and the Wet Mountains.

* WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to 5 PM MST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult, particularly over the
Palmer Divide. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce
visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening
commute on Monday and morning commute on Tuesday. The cold wind
chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia if
precautions are not taken.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 PM MST TUESDAY
